THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON
09.01.2019, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE
FOLLOWING:

[OF
2019/KER/1023

Crl.MC.No. 173 of 2019

1.3..
ORDER
Petition filed under Section 482 Cr.P.C.

2. The petitioners are the accused in Crime No.
64 of 2017 of Thottilpalam Police Station
registered for the offences under Sections
143, 147, 153A & 342 r/w Section 149 of the
Indian Penal Code. The first respondent is
the victim. It is submitted that the matter
has been settled and the proceedings in the
criminal case may be quashed.

3. Heard the learned counsel for the petitioners
and the first respondent and the learned
Public Prosecutor.

4. I have perused the affidavit filed by the
first respondent, who has entered appearance
through counsel. I am satisfied that the
allegation of settlement is true and no public
interest is involved. There is no impediment
for granting the prayer of the petitioners.

In the result, this Crl.M.C. is allowed. The

Beil
Lape
ob
2019/KER/1023
Crl.MC.No. 173 of 2019
14...
proceedings in Crime No. 64 of 2017 of
Thottilpalam Police Station are quashed. The
learned magistrate may pass appropriate orders
for the disposal of the material objects, if
any, produced in the case.
Sd/-
K.ABRAHAM MATHEW
JUDGE
